==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=两岸三地|lit=two shores, three territories|type=211}}

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|兩岸}} ("two shores", referring to both sides of the Taiwan Strait) + {{lang|zh|三地}} ("three territories", referring to mainland China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong and/or Macau). Used since 1997.

|cat=n

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# [[mainland China]], [[Taiwan]], and [[Hong Kong]] and/or [[Macau]] combined; three places across the [[Taiwan Strait]]
